page.title: 02History of Papworth Everard
page.content:
In 1918 Dr. Pendril Varrier-Jones (Cambidgeshire's Officer for TB) with financial help from well-wishers purchased the Papworth Estate. He wished to build a village where TB sufferers could live and work as valued members of the community along with their families. This work developed and became known inter- nationally.
As TB was gradually eliminated, the trust began to turn its attention to handicapped people, and this is the field in which it now specialises. Half of the inhabitants of Papworth are there because of their handicap and now live very full lives.
